name: PaintShop Pro Image
summary: Learn about .PSP files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: PaintShop Pro, often called "PSP," is an image editor that provides similar capabilities to Adobe Photoshop. For example, it allows you to edit images and digital photos with various tools and includes beginner-friendly and advanced workspaces.

Before being replaced by the PSPIMAGE format when Corel released version 8 of Paint Shop Pro, the PSP format was the native format for saving images with the application. After saving an image as a PSP file, you can close it and re-open it to continue editing it.
While Corel replaced the PSP format with the PSPIMAGE format, PaintShop Pro can still save images as PSP files. To create a PSP file with PaintShop Pro:
Select File → Save or Save As.
NOTE: Jasc Software developed PaintShop Pro before Corel acquired it in 2004.

description: A PSP file is a colored bitmap image created with PaintShop Pro. It is the native file format of PaintShop Pro and supports uncompressed, RLE compressed, LZ77 compressed, and JPEG compressed files (including Lossless JPEG). It also supports layers similar to PSD files and can have other information such as guides, metadata, and relevant objects within the image file. Each layer can be edited and integrated with the main image by its own. PSP files can be opened with PaintShop Pro software.

A PSP file is a bitmap image saved in the native Paint Shop Pro (PSP) format. It may include layers, guides, metadata, and other objects within the image. Corel replaced the PSP format with the .PSPIMAGE format when it released version 8 of Paint Shop Pro (now PaintShop Pro).

instructions: You can open a PSP file with Corel PaintShop Pro (Windows) by selecting File → Open. You can also open PSP files with other image editors, such as the 32-bit version of CorelDRAW Graphics Suite (Windows and macOS) and ACD Systems Canvas (Windows).
Various applications, such as Corel PaintShop Pro and CorelDRAW Graphics Suite, can convert PSP files to other formats.
For example, PaintShop Pro can convert a PSP file to various image file types, including the following formats:
